thinking.disposable_income: Middle-income neighborhood with median household income around $65,000. Many working families with moderate disposable income. About 11% poverty rate indicates some economic constraints
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Moderate discretionary spending capacity. Residents are price-sensitive but can afford some additional transportation costs. Many households have significant retail spending in local commercial districts
thinking.accessibility: Mixed transit access - served by Blue Line and multiple bus routes but not as extensive as downtown areas. High car ownership rates (80%+ households have cars). Many residents commute by both car and transit. Good road network with access to expressways
thinking.decision_rationale: 1. Prioritize balanced options that don't overly burden either drivers or transit users given mixed-mode usage. 2. Moderate tax rates preferred due to middle-income status. 3. Support some driving fees to improve transit but avoid highest fees. 4. Lower transit fares beneficial for working families and transit-dependent residents. 5. Value improved travel times but weigh against cost impacts. Selected proposals balance these factors while maintaining reasonable costs and travel times for both modes
